intro: Galium jordanii var. intertextum, commonly known as Jordan's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces white to pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming from spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems. Galium jordanii var. intertextum is a low-growing perennial herb with a widespread distribution in arid regions.
